sentences.sContent: Warhol and Gould would have roundly resisted applying the stigma “hypochondriac” to their own terrors; it would have seemed to them a humiliating admission that they were making a fuss about nothing.
sentences.sContent_eng: Warhol and Gould would have roundly resisted applying the stigma “hypochondriac” to their own terrors; it would have seemed to them a humiliating admission that they were making a fuss about nothing.
sentences.sCn: 沃霍尔和古尔德严厉反对被冠以“忧郁症”来解释他们的假想恐惧，他们认为承认自己正被一件不存在的东西烦躁是一种耻辱。

sentences.sContent: I used to be a terrible hypochondriac when I was young and a great reader of medical dictionaries.
sentences.sContent_eng: I used to be a terrible hypochondriac when I was young and a great reader of medical dictionaries.
sentences.sCn: 我年轻时曾患有可拍的忧郁症 ，很爱读各种医学词典。

words.tran: 过分担心自己健康的；忧郁症的

trans.tranOther: someone who always worries about their health and thinks they may be ill, even when they are really not ill
